metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3420 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in newlib in versions prior to 4.0.0. Improper overflow validation in the memory allocation functions mEMALIGn, pvALLOc, nano_memalign, nano_valloc, nano_pvalloc could case an integer overflow, leading to an allocation of a small buffer and then to a heap-based buffer overflow.

notes.Note: eslerm> fixed for newlib-4.0.0 on 2020-11-17 with aa106b29a ("malloc/nano-malloc: correctly check for out-of-bounds allocation reqs")

criterions.comment: gcc-snapshot: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
newlib: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
